fiveWhys.title: 5 Whys Critical Thinking Trainer
fiveWhys.description: Develop your analytical skills by systematically examining learning challenges

lookBeyondSurface.title: Look Beyond the Surface
lookBeyondSurface.description: Don't accept the first answer. Dig deeper to find underlying causes.
lookBeyondSurface.example: Instead of 'I'm bad at math', ask 'What specific math concepts am I struggling with?'

questionAssumptions.title: Question Assumptions
questionAssumptions.description: Challenge what you think you know. Are your assumptions correct?
questionAssumptions.example: Is the teaching method the problem, or do I need different prerequisites?

multipleViews.title: Consider Multiple Perspectives
multipleViews.description: Look at the problem from different angles and viewpoints.
multipleViews.example: How would a teacher, peer, or expert view this learning challenge?

rootCauses.title: Focus on Root Causes
rootCauses.description: Identify what's really causing the issue, not just symptoms.
rootCauses.example: Poor grades are a symptom. What learning habits or gaps cause them?

connections.title: Make Connections
connections.description: Link this problem to broader patterns in your learning.
connections.example: Does this connect to how I approach other subjects or skills?

tips.start: Start with "Why" to focus on causes, not symptoms
tips.specific: Be specific rather than vague in your questioning
tips.challenge: Challenge assumptions in your previous answer
tips.systemic: Look for systemic or structural causes
tips.perspectives: Consider multiple perspectives on the problem

fiveWhys.title: 5 Whys Critical Thinking Trainer
fiveWhys.description: Develop your analytical skills by systematically examining learning challenges

defineProblem.title: Define the Learning Problem
defineProblem.guidance: Clearly state what specific learning challenge you're facing. Be precise and avoid vague statements.

prompts.0: What exactly are you struggling to understand?
prompts.1: When does this problem occur most?
prompts.2: How does this affect your learning goals?

defineProblem.criticalThinking: Critical thinking starts with clarity. A well-defined problem is half solved.

firstWhy.title: First Why - Immediate Cause
firstWhy.guidance: Ask why this learning problem exists. Focus on the most direct, observable cause.

prompts.0: What is the immediate reason for this difficulty?
prompts.1: What happens right before you encounter this problem?
prompts.2: What makes this topic particularly challenging?

firstWhy.criticalThinking: Look for evidence-based answers, not assumptions or emotions.

secondWhy.title: Second Why - Deeper Analysis
secondWhy.guidance: Now ask why that first cause exists. Start digging into underlying factors.

prompts.0: Why does that immediate cause happen?
prompts.2: What's missing that would prevent this cause?

secondWhy.criticalThinking: Question whether your first answer is complete. Are there hidden factors?

thirdWhy.title: Third Why - System Level
thirdWhy.guidance: Examine the systems, processes, or patterns that create the deeper causes.

prompts.0: Why do these conditions exist in your learning environment?
prompts.1: What patterns or habits contribute to this?
prompts.2: How do external factors influence this situation?

thirdWhy.criticalThinking: Think systemically. How do different elements interact to create this problem?

fourthWhy.title: Fourth Why - Fundamental Factors
fourthWhy.guidance: Look at fundamental skills, knowledge gaps, or structural issues.

prompts.1: What fundamental skills or knowledge are missing?
prompts.2: What would need to change to prevent this problem?

fourthWhy.criticalThinking: Consider long-term patterns and foundational elements.

fifthWhy.title: Fifth Why - Root Cause
fifthWhy.guidance: Identify the deepest, most fundamental cause that, if addressed, would solve the problem.

prompts.0: Why do these fundamental issues exist?
prompts.1: What's the ultimate root of this learning challenge?
prompts.2: If you could change one thing to solve this, what would it be?

fifthWhy.criticalThinking: The root cause should be actionable and within your power to influence.

1.title: Define the Learning Problem
1.guidance: Clearly state what specific learning challenge you're facing. Be precise and avoid vague statements.

prompts.0: What exactly are you struggling to understand?
prompts.1: When does this problem occur most?
prompts.2: How does this affect your learning goals?

1.criticalThinking: Critical thinking starts with clarity. A well-defined problem is half solved.

2.title: First Why - Immediate Cause
2.guidance: Ask why this learning problem exists. Focus on the most direct, observable cause.

prompts.0: What is the immediate reason for this difficulty?
prompts.1: What happens right before you encounter this problem?
prompts.2: What makes this topic particularly challenging?

2.criticalThinking: Look for evidence-based answers, not assumptions or emotions.

3.title: Second Why - Deeper Analysis
3.guidance: Now ask why that first cause exists. Start digging into underlying factors.

prompts.0: Why does that immediate cause happen?
prompts.2: What's missing that would prevent this cause?

3.criticalThinking: Question whether your first answer is complete. Are there hidden factors?

4.title: Third Why - System Level
4.guidance: Examine the systems, processes, or patterns that create the deeper causes.

prompts.0: Why do these conditions exist in your learning environment?
prompts.1: What patterns or habits contribute to this?
prompts.2: How do external factors influence this situation?

4.criticalThinking: Think systemically. How do different elements interact to create this problem?

5.title: Fourth Why - Fundamental Factors
5.guidance: Look at fundamental skills, knowledge gaps, or structural issues.

prompts.1: What fundamental skills or knowledge are missing?
prompts.2: What would need to change to prevent this problem?

5.criticalThinking: Consider long-term patterns and foundational elements.

prompts.0: Why do these fundamental issues exist?

questionSuggestions.practicalApplications: How can I practice this directly?
questionSuggestions.commonMistakes: What common mistakes should I avoid?
questionSuggestions.dailyApplications: How to apply this in daily life?
questionSuggestions.prerequisites: What prerequisites do I need to understand?
questionSuggestions.simpleAnalogy: Give me a simple analogy to understand

educationalFacts.0: Humans learn about 70% from experience, 20% from others, and 10% from books.
educationalFacts.1: Reading aloud increases memory retention by up to 15%.
educationalFacts.2: Our brains can store approximately 2.5 petabytes of information.
educationalFacts.3: Sleeping after studying improves memory recall by up to 30%.
educationalFacts.4: Teaching others is the best way to understand a topic.
educationalFacts.5: Taking handwritten notes improves comprehension more than typing.
educationalFacts.6: Studying for 30-50 minutes with short breaks is more effective than marathon sessions.
educationalFacts.7: Using different colors when taking notes increases memory recall by up to 25%.
educationalFacts.8: Studying in the same place every day helps the brain recognize that it's time to learn.
educationalFacts.9: Emotional involvement in learning improves long-term retention.
educationalFacts.10: Walking for 20 minutes can boost creativity and thinking power.
educationalFacts.11: Repeating information at specific intervals (spaced repetition) is highly effective for remembering.
educationalFacts.12: Mind mapping helps organize ideas and improve understanding of complex concepts.
educationalFacts.13: Keeping your body hydrated is important because even mild dehydration can impair focus.
educationalFacts.14: Making connections between new information and existing knowledge strengthens memory.
educationalFacts.15: Learning with various methods (visual, auditory, kinesthetic) helps reinforce concepts.
educationalFacts.16: Practice tests are more effective than re-reading material for testing understanding.
educationalFacts.17: Group studying can improve academic performance.
